item.title: ‘Whatever we did was not enough’: How Salt Typhoon slipped through the government’s blind spots

item.title: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures
item.description: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures Briefcase full of U.S. currency. (Getty Images) Who needs VC funding? item.title: When Browsers Become the Attack Surface: Rethinking Security for Scattered Spider
item.description: As enterprises continue to shift their operations to the browser, security teams face a growing set of cyber challenges. In fact, over 80% of security incidents now originate from web applications accessed via Chrome, Edge, Firefox, and other browsers. One particularly fast-evolving adversary, Scattered Spider, has made it their mission to wreak havoc on enterprises by specifically targeting

item.title: Presentation: The Friction Fix: Building Collaborative Relationships Between Teams
item.description:
Diana Montalion and Cat Morris discuss why large-scale transformations often fail, pinpointing six systemic friction points. They explain how architects can drive change by understanding organizational systems, designing knowledge flow, and architecting relationships. They argue that focusing on outcomes, managing resistance, and adopting a learning-driven mindset are critical to success.

By Cat Morris, Diana Montalion
